data.title: CTET Paper 2 Social Science 4th Jan 2022 (English-Hindi) SET N

en.value: The proximodistal principle is illustrated in which of the following examples?

options.value: Infants develop vision before the use of their arms.
Infants develop cognitive abilities and then learn language.
Infants first learn to move their torso and then their arms and legs.

hn.value: समीप-दूराभिमुख<span style=""> सिद्धांत</span>&nbsp;को निम्नलिखित में से किस उदाहरण में दर्शाया गया है?

options.value: शिशु अपनी बाहों के इस्तेमाल से पहले दृष्टि विकसित करते हैं।
शिशु संज्ञानात्मक क्षमता विकसित करते हैं और फिर भाषा सीखते हैं।
शिशु पहले अपने धड़ और फिर अपने हाथ और पैर हिलाना सीखते हैं।
शिशु बुदबुदाने से पहले किलकना सीखते हैं।
Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).
(A) और (R) दोनों सत्य हैं और (R) सही व्याख्या करता है (A) की।
(A) और (R) दोनों <span style="">सत्य</span> हैं लेकिन (R) सही व्याख्या नहीं है (A) की।
(A) सही है लेकिन (R) अ<span style="">सत्य</span> है।

en.value: Improved athletic abilities, participation in games with rules, logical thought processes that are centered around concrete experiences, are hallmarks of the period of -

hn.value: बेहतर एथलेटिक (शारीरिक) क्षमताएँ, नियमों के साथ खेलों में भागीदारी, तार्किक विचार प्रक्रियाएँ जो मूर्त अनुभवों के आसपास केन्द्रित होती हैं, वे किस अवधि के लक्षण हैं?

en.value: According to Piaget, the unfolding of biological changes that are genetically programmed is called -

hn.value: पियाजे के अनुसार आनुवंशिक रूप से क्रमादेशित जैविक परिवर्तनों का होना क्या कहलाता है?

en.value: Choose the correctly matched pair of stage and its characteristics as proposed by Jean Piaget

options.value: Concrete operational-Capable of operations but not abstraction
Formal operational-Unable to mentally reserve actions

hn.value: जीन पियाजे द्वारा प्रस्तावित अवस्था और उसकी विशेषताओं के सही सुमेलित युग्म का चयन कीजिए।

options.value: <span style="">संवेदी पेशीय गामक</span> अवस्था - मानसिक प्रहस्तन से जूझना
पूर्व संक्रियात्मक अवस्था - वस्तु स्थायित्व का विकास
मूर्त संक्रियात्मक अवस्था - संचालन क्रियाएंँ कर पाते हैं लेकिन अमूर्त नहीं
अमूर्त संक्रियात्मक अवस्था - प्रतिवर्ती क्रियाओं को मानसिक रूप से करने में अक्षम

en.value: Children talking aloud to themselves -

options.value: is an indication of their egocentricism.
helps them to regulate their thinking.
hinders their psychological and language development.
is an identifier of severe behavioral problems.

hn.value: बच्चे का अपने आप से बात करना -

options.value: उनकी सोच को विनियमित करने में उनकी मदद करता है।
उनके मनोवैज्ञानिक और भाषा विकास में बाधा डालता है।
गंभीर व्यवहार संबंधी समस्याओं का पहचानकर्ता है।

te.value:
లెవ్ వైగోట్స్కీ సిద్ధాంతం ప్రకారం మన పనితీరును మార్చడానికి సహాయపడే మరియు మార్చే సాంస్కృతిక సాధనాల ఉదాహరణలు క్రింది వాటిలో ఏవి?

(i) మ్యాప్స్

(ii) భాష

(iii) కాలిక్యులేటర్

(iv) పథకాలు

mr.value:
खालीलपैकी कोणती सांस्कृतिक उपकरणांची उदाहरणे आहेत जी लेव्ह वायगोत्स्कीच्या सिद्धांतानुसार आपल्या कार्यात मदत करतात आणि बदलतात?

en.value: Which of the following pedagogical principle would&nbsp;<strong><u>not</u></strong>&nbsp;be advocated by Lev Vygotsky?

options.value: Encourage children to use cultural tools

hn.value: निम्नलिखित में से किस शैक्षणिक सिद्धांत की लेव वायगोत्स्की द्वारा वकालत <strong>नहीं </strong>की जाएगी?

options.value: पुरस्कार और दंड को नियोजित करें
बच्चों को सांस्कृतिक साधनों का उपयोग करने के लिए प्रोत्साहन

en.value: Which of the following does&nbsp;<strong><u>not</u></strong>&nbsp;indicate a child-centered classroom?

options.value: Seating arrangement changes as per the activity.
Children&#39;s progress is reported in qualitative terms and on all aspects of development.
Teacher reads the textbook and writes answers on the blackboard for students to copy.
Children are engrossed in what they are doing.

hn.value: निम्नलिखित में से कौन बाल केन्द्रित कक्षा को&nbsp;<strong><u>नहीं</u></strong>&nbsp;दर्शाता है?

options.value: गतिविधि के अनुसार बैठने की व्यवस्था में परिवर्तन।
बच्चों की प्रगति गुणात्मक रूप से और विकास के सभी पहलुओं को ध्यान में रखते हुए रिपोर्ट की जाती है।
शिक्षक पाठ्यपुस्तक पढ़ता है और छात्रों को कॉपी करने के लिए ब्लैकबोर्ड पर उत्तर लिखता है।
बच्चे जो कर रहे हैं उसमें तल्लीन हैं।

en.value: In Lawrence Kohlberg&#39;s theory of moral development, the stage of &#39;social order maintaining&#39; is characterized by -

options.value: Fear of authority and avoidance of punishment.
Seeking affection and approval of others.
Each member of society having a personal duty to uphold laws.

hn.value: लॉरेंस कोहलबर्ग के नैतिक विकास के सिद्धांत में &#39;सामाजिक व्यवस्था बनाए रखने&#39; के चरण की विशेषता है -

options.value: अधिकार का डर और सज़ा से बचना
दूसरों का स्नेह और अनुमोदन प्राप्त करना
कानूनों को बनाए रखना समाज के प्रत्येक सदस्य का व्यक्तिगत कर्तव्य है

en.value: According to Howard Gardner -

options.value: there are several distinct types of intelligences.
intellectual trails can be classified along three dimensions-operations, contents and products.
intelligence consists of a general factor and some specific factors.

hn.value: हॉवर्ड गार्डनर के अनुसार -

options.value: बुद्धि के कई अलग-अलग प्रकार है।
बौद्धिक लक्षणों को तीन आयामों-संचालन, सामग्री और उत्पादों में वर्गीकृत किया जा सकता है।
बुद्धि में एक सामान्य कारक और कुछ विशिष्ट कारक होते हैं।

en.value: Use of gender neutral language and discussing gender as a social construct rather than being biologically determined would -

hn.value: जेंडर तटस्थ भाषा का प्रयोग व जैविक रूप से निर्धारित होने के बजाय एक सामाजिक निर्माण के रूप में जेंडर&nbsp;पर चर्चा करने से -

en.value: ________ should be followed by the teacher to facilitate learning of children from diverse backgrounds.

hn.value: विविध पृष्ठभूमि के बच्चों को सीखने की सुविधा के लिए शिक्षक द्वारा ______ का पालन किया जाना चाहिए।

en.value: Which of the following statements about Assessment of children is <u><strong>not </strong></u>correct?

options.value: Assessment should be undertaken to facilitate learning and should involve diverse tools.
Assessment should always be conducted as an activity separate from teaching-learning.
Assessment should give the teacher an opportunity to reflect upon her pedagogical strategies.
Assessment should focus upon cognitive, physical as well as psychological domains.

hn.value: बच्चों के मूल्यांकन के बारे में निम्नलिखित में से कौन-सा कथन सही <strong><u>नहीं</u></strong>&nbsp;है?

options.value: मूल्यांकन का प्रयोग सीखने को सुसाध्य करने के लिए किया जाना चाहिए तथा इसमें विविध तरीकों को शामिल करना चाहिए।
मूल्यांकन हमेशा शिक्षण अधिगम से अलग गतिविधि के रूप में किया जाना चाहिए।
मूल्यांकन को शिक्षक को अपनी शिक्षाशास्त्रीय गतिविधियों पर मनन करने के लिए मौके देने चाहिए।
मूल्यांकन को संज्ञानात्मक, शारीरिक और मनोवैज्ञानिक क्षेत्रों पर ध्यान केन्द्रित करना चाहिए।

en.value: Inclusion in education implies that

options.value: students are given admission selectively on the basis of their ability.
students make adjustments as per the demands of school.
all students study in same school irrespective of their differences.
students with disabilities study separately in special schools.

hn.value: शिक्षा में समावेशन का तात्पर्य है कि :

options.value: छात्रों को उनकी क्षमता के आधार पर चुनिंदा रूप से प्रवेश दिया जाता है।
छात्र स्कूल की मांँग के अनुसार समायोजन करते हैं।
व्यक्तिगत विभिन्नताओं के बावजूद सभी छात्र एक ही स्कूल में पढ़ते हैं।
विकलांग छात्र अलग से विशेष स्कूलों में पढ़ते है।
শিক্ষার্থীদের যোগ্যতার ভিত্তিতে বেছে বেছে ভর্তি করা
শিক্ষার্থীরা স্কুলের চাহিদা অনুযায়ী সমন্বয় করা
সকল শিক্ষার্থী তাদের পার্থক্য নির্বিশেষে একই স্কুলে অধ্যয়ন করা
প্রতিবন্ধী শিক্ষার্থীরা বিশেষ বিদ্যালয়ে আলাদাভাবে পড়াশোনা করা

en.value: Which of the following disability cause challenges in reading and comprehending the written materials?

hn.value: निम्नलिखित में से कौन-सी दिव्यांगता लिखित सामग्री को पढ़ने और समझने में चुनौतियों का कारण बनती है?

en.value: Which of the following will<strong> hinder</strong> inclusion of learners from disadvantaged and deprived groups?

hn.value: निम्न में से कौन-सा सुविधाहीन और वंचित समूहों के शिक्षार्थियों को शामिल करने में <b><u>बाधा</u></b>&nbsp;उत्पन्न करेगा?

bn.value: নীচের কোনটি সুবিধাবঞ্চিত ও বঞ্চিত গোষ্ঠীর শিক্ষার্থীদের অন্তর্ভুক্তিতে বাধা দেবে?

en.value: Which of the following is a correctly matched pair of appropriate accommodation strategy for inclusion of students with the specified disability?

options.value: Dysgraphia : Ensuring compulsory writing on un-ruled sheets
Dyslexia : Giving text with mixed uppercase and small letters for reading
Locomotor disability : Provision of classes on ground floor
Visual impairment : Using sign language for communication

hn.value: निम्नलिखित में से कौन-सा विकल्प दी गयी दिव्यांगता और सम्बंधित छात्रों के समावेशन हेतु यथोचित संयोजन रणनीति का सही युग्म है?

options.value: लेखनवैकल्य : बिना रेखाओं वाली कार्यपुस्तिका पर लेखन अनिवार्य करना
पठनवैकल्य : बड़े और छोटे अक्षरों को मिश्रित करके लेख पढ़ने को देना
गतिमान दिव्यांगता : भूतल पर कक्षाओं का प्रावधान
दृश्य बाधित : संचार के लिए सांकेतिक भाषा का उपयोग करना

en.value: Which of the following facilitates student&rsquo;s thinking?

hn.value: निम्नलिखित में से कौन-सा विकल्प विद्यार्थियों की सोच को सुसाध्य करता है?

en.value: It is important to ________ situations where the students are ________ listeners for long periods of time.

hn.value: ऐसी स्थितियांँ ________ महत्वपूर्ण हैं जहांँ छात्र लंबे समय तक ________ श्रोता होते हैं।

en.value: Which of the following is <u>correct</u> in context of learning?

options.value: Students learn best when they participate in culturally irrelevant activities.
Students learn best when they participate in meaningful activities.
Students learn least when they participate in culturally relevant activities.
Students learn least when they participate in meaningful activities.

hn.value: अधिगम के संदर्भ में निम्नलिखित में से कौन-सा कथन सही है?

options.value: छात्र सबसे अच्छा तब सीखते हैं जब वे सांस्कृतिक रूप से अप्रासंगिक गतिविधियों में भाग लेते हैं।
सार्थक गतिविधियों में भाग लेने पर छात्र सबसे अच्छा सीखते हैं।
छात्र सबसे कम तब सीखते हैं जब वे सांस्कृतिक रूप से प्रासंगिक गतिविधियों में भाग लेते हैं।
विद्यार्थी सबसे कम सीखते हैं जब वे सार्थक गतिविधियों में भाग लेते हैं।

en.value: While designing instructions, a teacher should ensure that her instructions does <u><strong>not</strong></u> ___________.

hn.value: निर्देश तैयार करते समय, एक शिक्षक को यह सुनिश्चित करना चाहिए कि उसके निर्देश :

options.value: छात्रों को भ्रमित और हतोत्साहित न करें।
अधिगम के स्थानांतरण में मददगार न हो।

te.value: సూచనలను రూపొందించేటప్పుడు, ఒక ఉపాధ్యాయుడు తన సూచనలు ___________ చేయకుండా చూసుకోవాలి.

mr.value: सूचना तयार करताना, शिक्षिकेने हे पाहिले पाहिजे की तिच्या सूचना _____________ नाहीत.

options.value: विद्यार्थ्यांना गोंधळात टाकणार्‍या आणि निरुत्साहित करणार्‍या

bn.value: নির্দেশনা প্রণয়নের সময় একজন শিক্ষককে নিশ্চিত করতে হবে যে তার নির্দেশনা ___________ হবে না।

options.value: વિદ્યાર્થીઓને મૂંઝવણમાં મૂકે અને નિરાશ કરે

ta.value: வழிமுறைகளை வடிவமைக்கும் போது, ஒரு ஆசிரியர் தனது வழிமுறைகள் _____________ செய்யக்கூடாது என்பதை உறுதி செய்ய வேண்டும்.

en.value: Which of the following is <u><strong>not</strong></u> promoted by the advocates of socio-constructivist approach of learning?

hn.value: अधिगम के सामाजिक-रचनात्मक दृष्टिकोण को समर्थन देने वाले शिक्षाविदों द्वारा निम्नलिखित में से किसे बढ़ावा <b><u>नहीं</u></b>&nbsp;दिया जाता है?

en.value: In order to enhance problem solving skills of students, which of the following is a good strategy?

options.value: Create situations that demands application of knowledge.
Give a list of facts to rote-memorize.
Instruct students to copy written information from board.
Teach content for getting good marks in exams.

hn.value: छात्रों के समस्या समाधान कौशल को बढ़ाने के लिए, निम्नलिखित में से कौन-सी एक अच्छी रणनीति है?

options.value: ऐसी परिस्थितियांँ बनाएँ जिनमें ज्ञान के अनुप्रयोग की मांँग हो।
रटने-याद करने के लिए तथ्यों की एक सूची दें।
छात्रों को बोर्ड पर लिखी जानकारी की नकल करने का निर्देश दें।
परीक्षा में अच्छे अंक प्राप्त करने के लिए विषयवस्तु पढ़ाएंँ।

en.value: A teacher should deal with the misconceptions among children by :

options.value: Identify but not attending those misconception.

A. ఆధారాల ఆధారిత అభిప్రాయాన్ని అందించండి

en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions/complete the statements that follow by choosing the most appropriate options out of the given ones.

There was a woman who was beautiful, who started with all the advantages, yet she had no luck. She married for love, and love turned to dust. She had bonny children, yet she felt they had been thrust upon her, and she could not love them. They looked at her coldly, as if they were finding fault with her. And hurriedly she felt she must cover up some fault in herself. Yet what it was that she must cover up she never knew. Nevertheless, when her children were present, she always felt the centre of her heart go hard. This troubled her, and in her manner she was all the more gentle and anxious for her children, as if she loved them very much. Only she herself knew that at the centre of her heart was a hard little place that could not feel love, no, not for anybody. Everybody else said of her: 'She is such a good mother. She adores her children'. Only she herself, and her children themselves, knew it was not so. They read it in each other's eyes.

There were a boy and two little girls. They lived in a pleasant house, with a garden, and they had discreet servants, and felt themselves superior to anyone in the neighbourhood. Although they lived in style, they felt always an anxiety in the house. There was never enough money. The mother had a small income, and the father had a small income, but not nearly enough for the social position which they had to keep up. The father went into town to some office. But though he had good prospects, these prospects never materialised. There was always the grinding sense of the shortage of money, though the style was always kept up.

options.value: <span style="">(b) is right and (a) is wrong</span>

The earth was green, the sky was blue,

I saw and heard one sunny morn

A skylark hang between the two;

A singing speak above the corn.

A stage below in gay accord,

White butterflies danced on wing, 

And still the singing skylark soared,

And silent sank and soared to sing,

The cornfield stretched a tender green

To right and left between my walks,

While swift the sunny moments slid,

Perhaps his mate sat listening long,

And listened longer than I did.

The powerful hind legs help Kangaroos to
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions/complete the statements that follow by choosing the most appropriate options out of the given ones.

1. The hopping kangaroo is a familiar sight in every snapshot relating to Australia. Members of the Kangaroo family can be as small as a rat or as big as a man. Kangaroos are found mainly in Australia, Tasmania and New Guinea. Kangaroos, which are big-footed marsupials that evolved in Australia, use their short front legs like arms. The man-sized kangaroos of Australia are capable of speeding up to 88 km/hr for short distances, their means of locomotion being their powerful hind legs, which carry them over the ground in jumps of 9m or more at a time.

2. Weighing around 70kg, they have an average lifespan of around sixty-eight years and a maximum lifetime of 20 years. When bothered by predators, kangaroos often head for the water, standing submerged to the chest, and attempting to drown the attacker by holding him under water. Another defensive technique is to get their back to a tree and kick at their adversary with their clawed hind feet, sometimes with sufficient force to kill a man. Normally shy animals, they alert other kangaroos of danger by beating on the ground with their hind feet. This loud alarm signal carries over a long distance.

3. The tail is important for kangaroos. It hold them in balance and supports them when they sit or fight against other kangaroos. The kangaroos uses its short legs or arms. With them it scratches itself, cleans its fur and holds branches when it eats leaves. Kangaroos are marsupials and the females carry new-borns in a pouch in front of their abdomens. The babies are born small and climb up into the safety of the pouch. There, for the next 255 days or so, they eat, sleep and grow. Once they reach full development, they leave the pouch. A young kangaroo that leaves the pouch is called a 'joey'. To keep from getting too hot, the kangaroos take naps in the afternoon and do most of their grazing at night. But the best stay-cool secret of these creatures is the spit bath! Kangaroos drool and lick saliva all over their faces and bodies down.

en.value: A panther&#39;s sense of smell is _______ a dog&#39;s.
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions/complete the statements that follow by choosing the most appropriate options out of the given ones.

There is a saying among the jungle folks that if the panther had as good a nose as its ears, there would have been only panthers in the forest.

What this jungle jargon actually means is that among its senses the panther has the keenest hearing and the dullest sense of smell. Its sight stands somewhere in between. This does not mean that the panther can't take scent at all. After all, the panther returns to its kill hidden by it under heavy undergrowth, solely by means of smell. Sportsmen who cannot resist smoking, unwittingly give themselves away while waiting in 'machans' for the panther. I have often seen panthers turning up at tiger's kill by taking scent of meat from a distance.

The nose of the panther stuck back on its pug face is obviously not intended to perform the same function as the protruded nose of the dog, the wolf and the jackal, who hunt solely by scent. The very position of the nose provides a clue to the importance Nature attaches to its function in the life of an animal. Among all its senses, the sense of hearing of the panther is, without doubt, the sharpest. Once, I felt called upon to settle the score with a particularly vicious panther that had killed a cow in a village after having spirited away its calf a few days earlier. The cow bore on its throat distinct marks of canines. It had been also hamstrung from behind. Obviously, it was the handiwork of two panthers, not of one. As I sat over the carcass, I heard after sometime a heated argument between the two panthers lurking in a patch of grass not far from their kill. What the argument was about was difficult to guess.

Once, I felt called upon to settle the score with a particularly vicious panther that had killed a cow in a village after having spirited away its calf a few days earlier. The cow bore on its throat distinct marks of canines. It had been also hamstrung from behind. Obviously, it was the handiwork of two panthers, not of one. As I sat over the carcass, I heard after sometime a heated argument between the two panthers lurking in a patch of grass not far from their kill. What the argument was about was difficult to guess.

There is a saying among the jungle folks that if the panther had as good a nose as its ears, there would have been only panthers in the forest.

What this jungle jargon actually means is that among its senses the panther has the keenest hearing and the dullest sense of smell. Its sight stands somewhere in between. This does not mean that the panther can't take scent at all. After all, the panther returns to its kill hidden by it under heavy undergrowth, solely by means of smell. Sportsmen who cannot resist smoking, unwittingly give themselves away while waiting in 'machans' for the panther. I have often seen panthers turning up at tiger's kill by taking scent of meat from a distance.

The nose of the panther stuck back on its pug face is obviously not intended to perform the same function as the protruded nose of the dog, the wolf and the jackal, who hunt solely by scent.
